title.value: Урожайность зерна пайзы и ее структура при различных сроках посева и нормах высева
Yielding capacity of Indian barnyard millet grain and its structure caused by various sowing terms and seeding rates
Yielding capacity of Indian barnyard millet grain and its structure caused by various sowing terms and seeding rates

journal.title: Agriculture - Problems and Prospects : collection of scientific papers

person.name: Isaev, S.V., Grodno State Agrarian Univ. (Belarus)

abstract.value: In the conditions of the Republic of Belarus in 2008-2011 there were presented results of field and statistic investigations of correlation between sowing terms, seeding rates and factors forming the yielding capacity of Indian barnyard millet (Echinochloa frumentacea). There were presented results of the correlative analysis of association between Indian barnyard millet grain yield and it composed elements, and the main statistic characteristics of quantitative variability of grain yield composed elements. In the conditions of Grodno region of Belarus the optimum values of productivity of Indian barnyard millet grain (17.3 centner/hectare), elements of its structure and morphological parameters (head length 9.5 cm, weight of 1000 grains 2.86 gram, and grain weight of one head 1.69 g) were obtained in case of the crop sowing in the third decade of May and seeding rate of 5 million germinating seeds per 1 hectare. There was marked a tendency of decreasing in plant productive bushiness (on 0,3-0,7 units) in case of extension of sowing terms from the second to the third decade of May and in process of increase in seeding rate from 3 up to 5 million germinating seeds per 1 hectare.
